variant.question: What is correct regarding antenna shadowing?

options.text: Poor reception of GPS signals due to very weak signals compared to the background noise at that frequency.
Terrain blocking the path between the transmitter and receiver/aircraft antenna.
Reduced reception by an antenna when part of the airframe blocks the signal to the antenna.
Protection of a radar-reception antenna from the strong signals produced by a nearby transmission antenna.

variant.question: Which of the following summaries lists only directional antennas?

options.text: Sense antenna, parabolic antenna, slotted planar array antenna, helical antenna.
Loop antenna, parabolic antenna, slotted planar array antenna, helical antenna.
Dipole antenna, loop antenna, parabolic antenna, slotted planar array antenna.
Dipole antenna, sense antenna, parabolic antenna, helical antenna.

variant.question: The following might be caused by antenna shadowing:

options.text: A weather radar failing to show a distant turbulent cloud due to the signals being blocked by a nearer cloud.
Blocking of a VOR transmission caused by buildings close to the antenna.
Poor radio reception of a VOR ident signal while the aircraft is making an orbit (360Â° medium-level turn).
An aircraft appearing as two distinct Indications on a radar controller's display.
